answers.answer: What symptoms of diabetes do you think you have?Any additional tests you want performed?What would put you at ease with knowing whether you have diabetes or not?

i was peeing alot but i think that could be down to drinking more water than usual (been exercising)i have cut down my water and the peeing has slowed downim tired alot of the time, and i had a dry mouth which has now gonei really dont want to have diabetes so i dont know why i am so worried that the result was negative and all the info i have been told by professionals have been good
i do have an obsessive streak which i have noticed recently

If the doctors ran all the tests, and all turned out to be negative for diabetes, then I'm pretty sure you don't have it.  They do check for type 1 and type 2.Could it be that you are just tired a lot and are searching for an explanation?  It is ok if you do.  But I don't know so am asking.Diabetes aside, what else is bothering you?  Go deep on this one.

Ive been stressed due to work being slow and i am in a long distance relationshipi see my partner once a month atm and when i am with him i am perfectly fine, when i am back home (currently with my folks) i tend to worry over things

feeling stuck?  going to make any changes?I had a long distance relationship once.  It always felt like we were just dating rather than in a relationship.Here's what you ought to do for yourself:   come to some resolution about how you're going to make your situation better.  Maybe you can talk to a buddy since good ideas sprout from communal brainstorming.  Maybe you need some back-up and firepower for this too and let your doc know you want to see a therapist or psychiatrist.  Often times, this tag-team affair gets you back up to speed quicker than if you just ruminate in the privacy of your office cube.You'll begin to feel a whole lot better once you start to make some decisions about where you want to be.

That is good advice, i am going to see my best friend this Sat for a good long chathe knows me very wellI do feel stuck atm and feel that things arnt moving fast enough and with the distance etc.sometimes i feel though when things go well for me one part of my life, that i tend to get myself stressed or obsess over something, eg this diabetes issue

question: Hi all,I have been a little worried of recent if i have diabities as it runs in my family and i have had the symptomsSo i went for a blood test at my local chemist and my result after fasting was 4.7 which i was told was fineFor some reason i convinced myself that i still had it, phoned helplines and even my doctor and i was told not to panic and that i am perfectly fineFor some reason its all i can think about, i do seem to be obsessing over it when i know deep down i dont have itI am a little stressed with life in general atm and was wondering if this is a part of it plus i am abit of a worrierany advice would be great
title: Have i got Anxiety??
